ABOUT_KARROT.EXISTING_GROUPS: A few groups already using Karrot

ACTIVITIES.DESCRIPTION: Each activity has a number of slots which members of the group can sign up for â€“ this way everyone knows who goes where and when, and feedback can be given later.
ACTIVITIES.SUBTITLE: Activities with a specific time and place, like meetings, food pickups, community events, or whatever your group needs can be entered in the software.
ACTIVITIES.TITLE: Distribution of tasks and activities

COMMUNICATION.DESCRIPTION: Write a message that everyone in the group will see or a private message to someone. Everything related to a single activity or place can be discussed in their respective chats.
COMMUNICATION.TITLE: Communication in the right context

DEMOCRATIC.DESCRIPTION: Karrot is made by its users: a free and open-source software developed with the feedback and participation of the people who use it. It is mainly developed by a small core team that is constantly in contact with people in different groups, in order to make sense of their diverging and converging needs and thus guide the development. We abide by the ethics of integrity and non-commercialization of data.
DEMOCRATIC.DESCRIPTION2: Developers and designers are obviously welcome to participate in its development.
DEMOCRATIC.TITLE: Democratic and participative development

GROUPS.DESCRIPTION: Yet they are all displayed on the map so that people can find and connect to other groups in their location and even globally.
GROUPS.SUBTITLE: Every group on Karrot is completely independent and can have their own logo, processes, rules and agreements.
GROUPS.TITLE: Independent groups

MAPS.DESCRIPTION: You have a map of where the places and the people doing the activities are located. You have a nice list of upcoming activities and can sign up for them online.
MAPS.TITLE: Maps and lists

NOTIFICATIONS.DESCRIPTION: You get notified about empty activities, new messages and new people wanting to join your group. But you can also turn it all off if you wish more peace!
NOTIFICATIONS.TITLE: Notifications

OFFERS.DESCRIPTION: Offers are visible to everyone in the group and people can show their interest on the offer's chat.
OFFERS.SUBTITLE: Create an offer of whatever you want to share or give away.
OFFERS.TITLE: Share things

OPENSOURCE.DESCRIPTION: Everything is transparent and possibly changeable. We encourage groups to host their own instances of the platform, if they have the ability to do so. Still, we also provide access to a hosted version on karrot.world.
OPENSOURCE.TITLE: Open source

TEAM.DESCRIPTION: You can easily talk to the people developing Karrot, either on our {forum}, on {code} or in real-time on our {chat}.
TEAM.TITLE: Responsive team

TRANSLATIONS.DESCRIPTION: Karrot is fully translatable by the community and many languages are already added. To contribute more translations just visit the project on {translations}.
TRANSLATIONS.TITLE: Multi-language

TRANSPARENCY.DESCRIPTION: The history shows who did what and when. Everything from participating in an activity to creating and editing places is logged here.
TRANSPARENCY.TITLE: Transparency

TRUST.DESCRIPTION: There are no admin superpowers in a Karrot group. People who receive enough trust-carrots from their peers will be able to edit and change settings in the group. When new people want to join your group they need to apply and answer questions your group can set, which anyone with editing rights can decline or approve. Likewise, if there is a conflict, the group can enter a voting system to resolve it in a communal way.
TRUST.TITLE: Democratic and trust-based group management

ABOUT_KARROT.SUBTITLE1: Karrot is a free and open-source tool for grassroots initiatives and groups of people that want to coordinate face-to-face activities on a local, autonomous and voluntary basis.
ABOUT_KARROT.SUBTITLE2: It is designed in ways to enable community-building and support a more transparent, democratic and participatory governance of your group.
ABOUT_KARROT.TITLE: Start a group, become a community
ABOUT_KARROT.VISION_INTRO: Whether you are saving and sharing food, running a free shop or a makerspace, keeping a community garden or a bike-kitchen...

ACTIVITYDELETE.DELETE_SERIES_TEXT: Do you really want to delete this series? This will also delete all activities that belong to this series (except where people joined already).

ACTIVITYLIST.AVAILABLE: There is one activity in your favorite places waiting for you! | There are {count} activities in your favorite places waiting for you!
ACTIVITYLIST.AVAILABLE_FEEDBACK: You can give feedback | {count} activities await your feedback
ACTIVITYLIST.AVAILABLE_FROM_STORES: This shows activities from your favorite places in the next days. You can access other places in the sidebar.

ITEM.JOIN_CONFIRMATION_TEXT: Are you sure you have time on {date}?
ITEM.LEAVE_CONFIRMATION_TEXT: Are you really sure the others can do this without you?

ACTIVITYLIST.JOINEDNOTICE: You have one upcoming activity | You have {count} upcoming activities
ACTIVITYLIST.NONE_HINT: You can create a new activity on the place page.
ACTIVITYLIST.STORE_NONE_HINT: You can create a new activity on the 'Manage Activities' page.

ACTIVITYMANAGE.ACTIVITY_DOES_NOT_MATCH: This date doesn't match the recurrence pattern
ACTIVITYMANAGE.TITLE: Manage activities

ACTIVITY_FEEDBACK.AMOUNT: Amount of food you were able to save
ACTIVITY_FEEDBACK.AMOUNT_INFO: For place statistics, we will add together the amount of all feedback.
ACTIVITY_FEEDBACK.COMMENT_PLACEHOLDER: Was everything fine? Did everyone show up? Your comment here...
ACTIVITY_FEEDBACK.TITLE: Feedback
ACTIVITY_FEEDBACK.DISMISS_MESSAGE: Do you really want to dismiss this feedback? You won't be able to give feedback for this activity later on.

ACTIVITY_TYPES.FEEDBACK_YES_HINT: The participants will be asked for feedback about the activity
ACTIVITY_TYPES.NAME: Name
ACTIVITY_TYPES.STANDARD_NAME_HINT: Name will be available in other languages
ACTIVITY_TYPES.CUSTOM_NAME_HINT: Name will be used exactly as you write it and not translated
ACTIVITY_TYPES.CUSTOM_NAME_PROMPT: Type a custom name, or choose a standard name
ACTIVITY_TYPES.STATUS_ACTIVE_HINT: You will be able to create new activities and series of this type
ACTIVITY_TYPES.STATUS_ARCHIVED_HINT: It will not be possible to create new activities or series of this type, but existing ones will still be available

AGREEMENT.BLURB1: You don't have an agreement yet!
AGREEMENT.BLURB2: If you add one then people will have to agree to it before they can do pickups.

REMOVE.MESSAGE: This means anyone will be able to do a pickup
REMOVE.TITLE: Remove agreement?

REPLACE.MESSAGE: Everyone will have to agree again before they can signup for pickups
REPLACE.TITLE: Change agreement?

AGREEMENT.MINOR_EDIT_HELPER: Typos, formatting, etc... people will not be asked to re-agree
AGREEMENT.TITLE: Title
AGREEMENT.TITLE_HELPER: Give your agreement a title, e.g. Community Rules

APPLICATION.ACCEPT_CONFIRMATION_TEXT: Are you sure you want to accept {userName} into this group?
APPLICATION.DECLINE_CONFIRMATION_TEXT: Are you sure you want to decline the application of {userName}?
APPLICATION.GALLERY_TOOLTIP: You applied to join this group. Your application is still pending.
APPLICATION.HELP: This is a chat between all existing members of {groupName} and the new applicant {userName}. It is meant to give you all a chance to get to know you before deciding whether to accept, decline or withdraw the application.
APPLICATION.WALL_NOTICE: There is an application pending! | There are {count} applications pending!

INFO.MESSAGE: This is a score voting in which group members can participate to determine how to deal with a social conflict that affects the whole group.
INFO.TITLE: How does this process work?

REQUIREMENTS.NEWCOMER: Before you can start a conflict resolution process, you need to receive more trust and gain editing permissions. In the meantime, please ask a fellow group member to start the process for you.

CONFLICT.STEPPER1a: You are about to start a group-wide conflict resolution process!
CONFLICT.STEPPER1b: This will involve all members to find the best way to proceed.
CONFLICT.STEPPER2a: Thank you for caring for your community!
CONFLICT.STEPPER2b: It is important to address social issues, although it can be unpleasant sometimes. Thank you for your courage!
CONFLICT.STEPPER3b: This process will start a chat and a vote.
CONFLICT.STEPPER3c: The chat will be visible for members and includes {userName}.
CONFLICT.STEPPER3d: The voting is anonymous. It will go on for {votingDuration} days. During this time all voters can change their minds and vote differently as many times as they want.
CONFLICT.STEPPER4a: Please explain why you are starting this conflict resolution process!
CONFLICT.STEPPER4b: Tell your group what made you think this process is justified and needed. This statement will be visible to {userName} and group members.

VOTING.HEADLINE: How do you want to proceed with the ongoing conflict with {userName}?

CONFLICT.WITH: This process is to resolve a conflict with {userName}

CONVERSATION.CLOSED: This conversation has been closed automatically.
CONVERSATION.NOT_PARTICIPATED: By sending a message, you will be subscribed to notifications about this conversation.
CONVERSATION.UNREAD_MESSAGES: You have one unread message. | You have {count} unread messages.

CREATEACTIVITY.COMMENT_HELPER: What should people know when signing up to this?
CREATEACTIVITY.DIFFERS_WARNING: This value differs from the default. To undo this change, click on the arrow button and save the changes.
CREATEACTIVITY.ENABLE_DISABLE_MESSAGE: Users who joined will get a notification. You can change this text to provide a reason:

CREATEACTIVITY.RRULE_HELPER: Type in a valid {ruleHelper}, e.g. {ruleExample} or {ruleExample2}
CREATEACTIVITY.WEEKDAYS_HELPER: On which days should it take place?

USERDATA.FIRST_TRUST: Be the first one to trust {userName} in {groupName}!
USERDATA.NEWCOMER_GUIDANCE: {userName} is new to your group and might need some guidance.
USERDATA.NEWCOMER_INFO: You are currently a newcomer in {groupName} and you can become active by writing messages, meeting fellow members, doing activities and giving feedback. As soon as {threshold} members expressed their trust in you, you will gain editing permissions to help with group administration.
USERDATA.OTHER_PEOPLE_TRUST_YOU: {otherUser} trusts you in {groupName}. | {count} people trust you in {groupName}.
USERDATA.PEOPLE_TRUST_USER: You and {otherUser} trust {userName} in {groupName}. | You and {count} other people trust {userName} in {groupName}.

TRUST_INFO.LINK: Click here to find out more.
TRUST_INFO.MESSAGE: It is part of the Karrot trust system. It shows if a group member is newcomer and how much trust is needed until they gain editing permissions.

VALIDATION.MAXLENGTH: Too long, please use less than {max} characters.
